parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and the base of basis; to walk upon, i.e. Mount, ascend, embark, arrive.
Belonging to Adramyttium, a port in Mysia, in Asia Minor. From Adramutteion; Adramyttene or belonging to Adramyttium.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
Another form for pleuo; which is used as an alternate in certain tenses; probably a form of pluno; to pass in a vessel.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Asia, i.e. Asia Minor, or only its western shore.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
From the same as ariston and archo; best ruling; Aristarchus, a Macedonian.
A Macedon, i.e. Inhabitant of Macedonia.
A Thessalonian. From Thessalonike; a Thessalonican, i.e. Inhabitant of Thessalonice.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
